arts.ttl: Fiorentina’s Moise Kean establishes reinvigoration with hat-trick against Verona
arts.sum: Serie A side Fiorentina picked up a 3-1 win over Verona earlier today, climbing upto third in the table. But the win came as a result Moise Kean’s sensational hattrick.…

arts.ttl: Roma crisis deepens with loss to Bologna and Juric fired. Atalanta and Fiorentina join Napoli at top
arts.sum: Roma announced shortly after the game that Juric had been fired, marking the club’s second coaching change this season. Atalanta and Fiorentina both won to move level on points with Serie A leader Napoli, which visits defending champion Inter Milan later Sunday.

arts.ttl: Palladino: ‘Fiorentina want to continue to surprise and grow’
arts.sum: Following Fiorentina’s 3-1 victory over Verona, coach Raffaele Palladino addressed the media at the Artemio Franchi stadium, expressing his satisfaction with the team’s performance. He stated, “It depends only on us if we can stay in this part of the standings. This is a competitive group that wants to continue to surprise and grow.” Palladino emphasized his focus on individual player development rather than the league table, saying, “I don’t look at the standings; I care about the growth of each player.” The coach dedicated the win to Ikoné, who recently experienced a personal loss, remarking, “We dedicate this victory The post Palladino: ‘Fiorentina want to continue to surprise and grow’ appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Fiorentina 3-1 Verona: Match Report
arts.sum: Moise Kean delivered a spectacular performance, netting a hat-trick to lead Fiorentina to their sixth consecutive Serie A victory. The win temporarily places the Viola joint top of the table after a convincing 3-1 triumph over Hellas Verona. The match began with an early breakthrough as Kean capitalized on Lucas Beltran’s through ball, scoring just four minutes into the game. This marked Kean’s third consecutive league match with a goal, showcasing his impressive form. Verona managed to equalize through Suat Serdar’s stunning long-range effort, but Fiorentina’s dominance was restored when Kean acrobatically volleyed in Yacine Adli’s corner kick. arts.ttl: Fiorentina host Verona to continue the run of form
arts.sum: Hellas Verona – courtesy of four wins and seven defeats in Serie A this term – are only one of the three teams yet to draw a single match in the big five European Leagues 2024-25, alongside Barcelona and Le Havre; the last league game drawn by the Gialloblù was in May, against Inter (2-2) at the Bentegodi. Fiorentina have won the last five league games, last winning more matches in a row in Serie A back to the period February-April 2018, under Stefano Pioli (a run of six).

arts.ttl: Serie A | Fiorentina v Verona: Match Preview
arts.sum: Fiorentina will aim to extend their impressive run of form when they host Hellas Verona at the Stadio Artemio Franchi on Sunday in Serie A action. The Viola have been one of the surprise packages of the season so far under new manager Raffaele Palladino, currently sitting fourth in the table just three points off the top. La Viola enter this match on a five-game winning streak in Serie A, their best run of form in nearly seven years.
